info.title: Scheduling Legacy API v1
info.description: Legacy v1 Platform API endpoints for scheduling domain including appointments, bookings, services, and availability

get.description:
## Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of appointments for the business. Supports filtering by client, appointment state, and sorting.

## Booking note
Appointments are the scheduled items on the business calendar. To **create** an appointment (and to handle client lifecycle actions such as reschedule/cancel), use the Bookings endpoints (for example: `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings`).

Available for **Staff and Application tokens**.

parameters.description: How many items to return per page. Default: 25. Max: 100
parameters.name: per_page

get.description:
## Overview
Get appointment details by ID.

## Booking note
If your goal is to **create** appointments or manage client lifecycle actions (reschedule/cancel), look for the Bookings endpoints (for example: `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings`).

Available for **Staff and Application tokens**.

## Overview
Get bookings of the authenticated client. Returns a paginated list of the client's appointments and event registrations.

Available for **Client tokens** only.

parameters.description: Maximum number of records which are returned for the request
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: First record's index in the returned list (e.g. per_page = 10, offset = 1, reords 11 to 20 are returned)
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: If equals to true, returns records from the past only. Otherwise, returns future bookings as well.
parameters.name: passed

parameters.description: Relevant to recurring appointment/event, returns appointment/event attendance which their start_time is bigger than this parameter
parameters.name: start_time

parameters.description: Relevant to recurring appointment/event, returns appointment/event attendance which their start_time is smaller than this parameter
parameters.name: end_time

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a booking for either an appointment with a staff member or registration for a group event.

## Relationship to appointments and events
A **booking** is the lifecycle/action interface for scheduled items:
- For an **appointment booking**, this endpoint creates the appointment on the business calendar and returns it as a `booking` object.
- For an **event registration**, this endpoint creates a registration (attendance) for the event instance and returns it as a `booking` object.

## When to use
If you are looking for an endpoint to **create appointments** or **register clients to events**, this is the endpoint to use.

Available for **Client and Staff tokens**.

client_id.description: Client uid. If not provided, form_data with client fields (email, first_name) is required.

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required for event registration (not appointment booking).

fields.description: Array of field objects. Each object must have field_id (from form definition), type (field type like 'email', 'first_name'), and new_data (the value as string).

field_id.description: The field ID from the scheduling form definition

new_data.description: The field value as a string

service_fields.description: Service-specific custom fields (same structure as fields)

meeting_details.description: Meeting location details (required for client_location or phone_call services)

meeting_interaction_details.description: Location or contact details for the meeting

portal_id.description: Business uid (same as business_id, for portal context)

service_id.description: Service uid. Required for appointment booking.

staff_id.description: Staff uid. Required for appointment booking.

time_zone.description: Default is set to UTC if not provided

post.description:
## Overview
Cancel booking Available for **Staff, App, Directory, and Client tokens**.

booking_id.description:
Booking (appointment/event) uid. Can be obtained from:
- `GET /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` (requires Client token)
- `GET /platform/v1/scheduling/appointments` (returns `id` field which is the booking_id)
- Response from `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` (returns `data.booking.id`)

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required only for cancelling event registrations (not appointments).

put.description:
## Overview
Update RSVP state for a booking. Available for **Client tokens** only.

## Required Parameters
- `booking_uid` (path): The booking UID
- `new_rsvp_state` (query): Valid values: 'confirmed', 'cancelled', 'pending'
- `appointment_type` (body): 'appointment', 'event_instance', or 'event_attendance'
- `business_id` (body): The business UID

parameters.description: New RSVP State. 'confirmed' is the only valid option. any other state is forbidden (return 403)
parameters.name: new_rsvp_state

get.description:
## Overview
Get Event attendance details for a specific event attendance record.

## Booking note
To **register a client** to an event instance, create a booking using `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` and provide `event_instance_id`.

Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Notes
- The event attendance UID can be obtained from the event attendance creation response (POST to `/v2/event_instances/{event_instance_id}/event_attendances`) or from the event instance details.
- Previously documented under `/api/v2/event_instances/{event_instance_id}/event_attendances/{id}`, but that v2 nested route does not have a working `show` action. The correct route is `/platform/v1/scheduling/event_attendances/{event_attendance_uid}`.

parameters.description: Event attendance UID. Obtain from event attendance creation response or event instance attendees list (e.g., `$.data.event_attendance.uid`).
parameters.name: event_attendance_uid

get.description:
## Overview
Get Event Instance Details.

## Booking note
To **register a client** to this event instance, create a booking using `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` and provide `event_instance_id`.

Available for **Staff, Directory, and Client tokens**.

parameters.description: The id of the event instance
parameters.name: event_instance_id

post.description:
## Overview
Join an event waitlist.

## Booking note
To **register a client** directly to an event instance (instead of joining the waitlist), create a booking using `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` and provide `event_instance_id`.

Available for **Staff, App, Directory, and Client tokens**.

## Client Identification
Client tokens: The client is identified from the token.
Staff/App/Directory tokens: Must provide `client_id` to identify which client to add to the waitlist.

## Note
Validation errors may return dynamic form field IDs. To get the form field definitions, call `GET /platform/v1/forms?business_id={business_id}&form_type=scheduling&service_uid={event_service_id}`.

client_id.description: Client UID. Required for Staff/App/Directory tokens.

event_instance_id.description: Event instance UID. Required - identifies which event to join the waitlist for.

matter_uid.description: Matter/conversation UID to associate with this waitlist entry.

time_zone.description: Time zone for the waitlist entry.

put.description:
## Overview
Cancel a waitlist registration.

## Booking note
To **register a client** to an event instance (instead of joining a waitlist), create a booking using `POST /platform/v1/scheduling/bookings` and provide `event_instance_id`.

Available for **Client tokens**.

The underlying controller inherits from `Api::ClientApi::V1::BaseController`, which only accepts client authentication.

## Required Fields
- **Always required**: `business_uid`, `event_instance_uid`, `client_uid`, and `matter_uid`
- `client_uid` must be explicitly provided in the request body for the authorization check to pass. The controller extracts it from the request parameters, not from the token.
- `matter_uid` is used to look up the specific waitlist entry to cancel.

## Note
Staff can cancel waitlist entries using the business API endpoint `PUT /business/scheduling/v1/waitlist/cancel` which supports staff tokens and the `waitlist_uid` parameter.

client_uid.description: Client UID. Required. Must be explicitly provided in the request body for the authorization check (`authorize_action(:cancel_waitlist)`) to pass. The controller reads this from `params[:client_uid]`, not from the token.

event_instance_uid.description: Event instance UID. Required. Identifies which event's waitlist to cancel from.

matter_uid.description: Matter/conversation UID. Required. Used to look up the specific waitlist entry to cancel.

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'
